content:
This is pretty hard. I got 100% on test cases in a clash just now, but then got 88% in the end because of Validator 4.

Distinguishing between "None" and "Infinite" is the trickiest part, and Validator 4 is the only Infinite/None test where you have both c1 and c2 are 0, which makes it hard to check if the two equations are just the same equation with a scaling factor (i.e. Infinite), because my test involved dividing a1/a2, b1/b2 and c1/c2 and comparing these, which of course fails here because c2 = 0.

It would be good to have a similar test case added so that clashers can debug this in-clash, so they don't get stung by this edge case.

I ended up winning anyway with 88% because everyone else got 0%. Quite a tough clash, but interesting.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this one, it's funny, don't take much time and i just enjoy it !
とても難しいですが面白いです

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems all good now.

Re-posting a previous comment here for the author because withdrawal of my rejection deletes that comment.

In Python, you can require to always show a specified number of decimal places by using the print formatting options instead of relying on the round function:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1995615/how-can-i-format-a-decimal-to-always-show-2-decimal-places

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good job
When will you make it public? I'm itching to approve this!!!

Title
* Please change "Simul" to "Simultaneous".

* Please change "equation" to "equations".

Goal
* Please change "an algorithm" to "a program".

* Please change "simul" to "simultaneous".

* Please change "equation" to "equations" and add a full-stop.

Input
* Please add "and space-separated" after "floats".

Output
* Please mention the rounding requirement. Preferably round to and show 3 decimal places for all outputs for simplicity.

Constraints
* The inputs in some cases are negative or zero and hence outside the range stated in the first constraint. Please fix the cases and/or the constraint.

Thanks.

Thank you for your advice.
I actually got confused by the shortened form of the word "simultaneously"
@Silver Your output requirement is very confusing. Would you please consider standardising all output to show 3 decimal places?
Seems no issues for now… Weirdly no visible tests require an output of a rounded negative integer, but hopefully that won't be an issue…
MMmm... I agree with @5DN1L, fix the output requirement. I WILL approve. Just fix that.

I think if the author doesn't want to change the output, they should at least change the wording in the Output section.

"rounded to 3 decimal places or less" seems to suggest that the player has a choice in deciding how many decimal places to round to. I would at least change that to "If any number in the output has more than 3 decimal places, then it should be rounded to 3 decimal places. If any number is an integer, then it should be shown with 1 decimal place. Otherwise, the number is shown as is."

I hate such long wording, so I'd much prefer if the author simply changes all outputs to show 3 decimal places for simplicity.

No worries.

Please change "the 3rd decimal" to "3 decimal places".

Please also change all the output to show 3 decimal places (e.g. 1.0 becomes 1.000). Otherwise, you'll have to explain how the decimal parts should be shown.

Thanks again.
